Sentencas: The present investigation looks at the effect of Ga3+ doping for B-site Ti4+ on the phase stability and oxygen-ion conductivity of Na0.54Bi0.46TiO3-delta for the possible electrolyte application in low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity study of B-site Ga doped non-stoichiometric sodium bismuth titanate ceramics

Sentencas: Dense bulk samples were prepared using the conventional solid-state route.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity study of B-site Ga doped non-stoichiometric sodium bismuth titanate ceramics

Sentencas: Although XRD revealed the presence of a single rhombohedral perovskite phase, SEM study indicated the existence of impurity phase in the form of fibers in the as-sintered samples.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity study of B-site Ga doped non-stoichiometric sodium bismuth titanate ceramics

Sentencas: The local chemical compositional analysis showed Na/Bi molar ratio to be > 1 in the perovskite phase of all the tested compositions and the existence of Na2Ti6O13 compound in the impurity phase.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity study of B-site Ga doped non-stoichiometric sodium bismuth titanate ceramics

Sentencas: Impedance spectroscopy studies suggested a monotonous decrease in bulk conductivity on Ga3+ doping on the B-site of Na0.54Bi0.46TiO3-delta.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity study of B-site Ga doped non-stoichiometric sodium bismuth titanate ceramics

Sentencas: The bulk conductivity of 7.8 mS/cm measured in Na0.54Bi0.46TiO3-delta at 600 degrees C declined to 5.8 mS/cm on 2 at.% Ga3+ doping.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity study of B-site Ga doped non-stoichiometric sodium bismuth titanate ceramics

Sentencas: The conductivity reduction was attributed to the formation of local defect clusters which act as sinks, and thus leads to decrease in the concentration of free oxygen vacancy.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity study of B-site Ga doped non-stoichiometric sodium bismuth titanate ceramics

Sentencas: Although not much change in initial bulk conductivity of Na0.54Bi0.46Ti0.99Ga0.01O3-delta was found under various atmospheres from 500 degrees C to 600 degrees C, the annealing study carried out at 600 degrees C for 12 h under 5% H-2-95% N-2 condition showed the decomposition of perovskite phase to form metallic Bi.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity study of B-site Ga doped non-stoichiometric sodium bismuth titanate ceramics

Sentencas: Both pure and Ga-doped samples showed a considerable conductivity degradation of 12% after 100 h ageing in air at 600 degrees C.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity study of B-site Ga doped non-stoichiometric sodium bismuth titanate ceramics

Sentencas: The phenomenon related to the formation of local defect clusters over time was proposed to be a possible reason for the observed conductivity decay.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity study of B-site Ga doped non-stoichiometric sodium bismuth titanate ceramics
Electrical conductivity study of B-site Ga doped non-stoichiometric sodium bismuth titanate ceramics
Electrical conductivity study of B-site Ga doped non-stoichiometric sodium bismuth titanate ceramics
